intro: Xanthophyllum oliganthum, commonly known as the golden-flowered shrub, is a perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in dense clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils with ample sunlight. Xanthophyllum oliganthum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
